name.description: Unique identifier for the MCP server. Must contain only alphanumeric characters and hyphens, with hyphens only between alphanumeric characters.

title.description: Human-readable display name for the MCP server.

summary.description: Brief one-line summary of what the MCP server does. Must not contain line breaks.

description.description: Detailed description of the MCP server's functionality, features, and use cases.

kind.description: Type of server implementation. 'mcp' for Model Context Protocol servers, 'rest' for REST API servers.

license.description: Licensing information for the MCP server.

url.description: URL to the full license text.

icon.description: URL to an icon image representing the MCP server.

externalDocumentation.description: Links to external documentation for the MCP server.

title.description: Title or name of the documentation.

url.description: URL to the source code repository.

source.description: Path or reference to specific source files within the repository.

useCases.description: List of specific use cases or scenarios where this MCP server is applicable.

name.description: Name or title of the use case.

description.description: Detailed description of the use case scenario.

tags.description: Keywords or labels for categorizing and discovering the MCP server.

vendor.description: Name of the organization or individual that created or maintains the MCP server.

visibility.description: Visibility level or access restrictions for the MCP server (e.g., 'public', 'private', 'enterprise').

categories.description: Functional categories or domains that the MCP server belongs to (e.g., 'database', 'api', 'analytics').

connectorName.description: Name of the connector or integration framework used by the MCP server.

securitySchemes.description: Authentication and authorization schemes supported by the MCP server.

packages.description: List of software packages, dependencies, or installation artifacts for the MCP server.

items.description: Package information including name, version, and installation details.

versionName.description: Version identifier for the MCP server. Must contain only alphanumeric characters and hyphens.

remote.description: Remote endpoint URL for connecting to the MCP server. Can be a direct URL or a URL template with placeholders in curly braces.

remoteType.description: Type of remote connection protocol used by the MCP server. 'sse' for Server-Sent Events, 'streamable-http' for streaming HTTP.

supportContact.description: Contact information for support or questions about the MCP server. Must be either a valid email address or URL.
